main event: On May 6, 1955, in Baltimore, Maryland, Mr. & Mrs. Heberlig witnessed two dark, circular objects in the sky, approximately 50 feet in diameter, moving at high speed in a northeasterly direction.
interesting points: The objects made no sound and left no trail as they moved at a high rate of speed.
The witnesses observed the objects for approximately 30-45 seconds before they disappeared from view.
The sighting is classified as unidentified based on the description provided.

Another sighting on May 7, 1955, by two independent witnesses described a strange aircraft as a black crescent or boomerang-shaped object in level flight at high altitude, which then accelerated to a tremendous speed and disappeared from view in about 20 seconds with no sound heard.
The witnesses were unable to account for the identity of the object, and the report was based on interviews of credible witnesses with reliable reports.
sighted object: dark, circular objects and a black crescent or boomerang-shaped object in the sky
witnesses: Mr. & Mrs. Heberlig, two independent witnesses
